Package de.htw.battleship

Class AI

java.lang.Object
de.htw.battleship.AI
public class AI
extends java.lang.Object
An instance of this class can generate shots for the villain (computer) to play, using 5 algorithms with different difficulties.

  • Constructor Details

    • AI

      public AI​(int level, Board playerBoard)
      Constructor of the class
      Parameters:
      level - The difficulty level of the AI
      playerBoard - The board of the player

  • Method Details

    • nextMove

      public Vector2d nextMove()
      Determines the algorithm used for the AI's next move based on the difficulty level
      Returns:
      The move returned from the executed algorithm

    • level0Algorithm

      private Vector2d level0Algorithm()
      Algorithm for AI testing difficulty. Designed to not hit any ships, cannot win.
      Returns:
      The position to play in the next move

    • level1Algorithm

      private Vector2d level1Algorithm()
      Algorithm for easiest AI difficulty. Chooses the next played position completely random.
      Returns:
      The position to play in the next move

    • level2Algorithm

      private Vector2d level2Algorithm()
      Algorithm for medium AI difficulty. Chooses the next played position random but does not choose any fields that have already been hit (or missed).
      Returns:
      The position to play in the next move

    • level3Algorithm

      private Vector2d level3Algorithm()
      Algorithm for advanced AI difficulty. Chooses the next played position random until it hits a ship. From that point on it plays pretty much like a human would: it shoots the fields next to it; as soon as it hits another part of the ship, it advances in that direction; if it reaches the end (of the ship or the board) without having sunk the ship, it returns to the starting position and continues in the other direction until the ship is sunk.
      Returns:
      The position to play in the next move

    • level4Algorithm

      private Vector2d level4Algorithm()
      Algorithm for the hardest AI difficulty. Given the nickname "sudden death", this algorithm makes the AI win as soon as it gets to play. The algorithm is designed to only hit fields that contain a ship.
      Returns:
      The position to play in the next move

    • listContainsArray

      private boolean listContainsArray​(java.util.ArrayList<Vector2d> arrayList, Vector2d vector)
      Checks if an ArrayList of type Vector2d contains a specific Vector2d
      Parameters:
      arrayList - The array list to be checked
      vector - The int[] to be checked
      Returns:
      Whether the given array list contains the given int[]

    • advance

      private Vector2d advance​(Vector2d move)
      Calculates the next field in the current direction.
      Parameters:
      move - The last "move" (position)
      Returns:
      The next field in the current direction

    • collidesWithBorder

      private static boolean collidesWithBorder​(int point)
      Checks whether a value is outside of the borders of the board.
      Parameters:
      point - The point being checked
      Returns:
      Whether the point lies outside of the borders of the board

    • hitsAgain

      private boolean hitsAgain​(Vector2d move)
      Checks whether the field at the given position was already shot at (whether it is a MISSED_SHOT or a HIT)
      Parameters:
      move - The position of the field being checked
      Returns:
      Whether the field at the given position was already shot at

    • hitsShip

      private boolean hitsShip​(Vector2d move)
      Checks whether the field at the given position is a SHIP
      Parameters:
      move - The position of the field being checked
      Returns:
      Whether the field at the given position is a SHIP

    • misses

      private boolean misses​(Vector2d move)
      Checks whether the field at the given position is a MISS
      Parameters:
      move - The position of the field being checked
      Returns:
      Whether the field at the given position is a MISS

    • resetAndTurnAround

      private void resetAndTurnAround()
      Reverses the current direction and goes back to the starting point of the current ship to keep shooting in the other direction

    • loseMemory

      public void loseMemory()
      Deletes the AI's "memory" by resetting all ship-specific attribute values (orientation, direction, lastMoves and testedDifferences)

    • getLevel

      public int getLevel()
      Getter for the level attribute
      Returns:
      The value of the level attribute (the AIs difficulty level)

    • setLevel

      public void setLevel​(int level)
      Setter for the level attribute
      Parameters:
      level - The desired difficulty level for the AI
